page.title: 17CHILDREN'S PASTIMES
page.content: The junior school children indicated in a questionnaire that they liked the quiet environment in which they lived, but almost all complained of lack of friends.Of the 14 children involved none played organised games or had favourite games.The Youth Club which meets weekly,caters for the ages 9-16 but only 6 of the juniors attend. 8 of the children have no regular friends and a similar number have no real interests or hobbies.Most have access, in the home,to 2 televisions,radio, record player and tape recorder,whilst about half can use video,home computer and T.V. games.Television is in daily use and oral questioning suggests excessive viewing time especially in winter and at weekends. Other audio visual aids are used occasionally.Most read for pleasure for about an hour a week and mainly in bed.
